thread.title: How much rain did Brockton-area get? Rainfall totals, rescues, injuries
thread.title_full: How much rain did Brockton-area get? Rainfall totals, rescues, injuries

author: , Enterprise News
title: How much rain did Brockton-area get? Rainfall totals, rescues, injuries
text:
How much rain did Brockton-area get? Rainfall totals, rescues, injuries
BROCKTON â€” A powerful rainstorm hit the Brockton area Wednesday, flooding streets and downing trees and power lines, according to the National Weather Service.
[The Brockton Fire Department performed two water rescues](https://www.enterprisenews.com/story/news/local/2024/12/12/brockton-ma-flood-overdose-rescue-westgate-mall-homeless-encampment/76944669007/) of individuals trapped by flood waters, according to Fire Chief Brian Nardelli.
"We had a lot of wire issues last night, a lot of tree limbs down. We had some issues on Oak Street with power outages. Those are the types of instances that tie up our fire apparatuses," Nardelli said. "It was throughout the entire city."
Here's everything you need to know about last night's storm.
Was anyone injured in the storm?
The Brockton Fire Department performed two water rescues Wednesday, according to Fire Chief Brian Nardelli.
Firefighters helped a family with a young child to safety after their car got stuck in flood waters on Westgate Drive. The water reached up to the car's floorboards when the family was rescued, according to Nardelli.
Firefighters also responded to a call for an overdose at the homeless encampment behind Westgate Mall. They had to fight through moving, murky, chest-deep flood waters filled with unseen obstacles to reach the victim and bring him back to safety, Nardelli said.
Firefighters administered Narcan to the man and he was stabilized and transported to the hospital, he said.
No firefighters were injured in either rescue.
How much rain did Brockton get?
Rain totals in Brockton have not been officially calculated but estimates range from 3 to 4 inches, according to NWS Meteorologist Candice Hrencecin.
How much rain did other Brockton area towns get?
Here's how much rain Brockton area towns and cities got, according to the latest [NWS rainfall reports](https://forecast.weather.gov/product.php?site=NWS&issuedby=BOX&product=PNS).
- Abington: 2.61 inches by 12:55 a.m., Dec. 12
- Bridgewater: 3.45 inches by 12:56 a.m., Dec. 12
- Easton: 2.93 inches by 10:25 p.m., Dec. 11
- Plymouth: 3.28 inches by 12:52 a.m., Dec. 12
- Randolph: 2.68 inches by 7:59 p.m., Dec. 11
- Raynham: 3.02 inches by 12:50 a.m., Dec. 12
- Taunton: 2.87 inches by 12:52 a.m., Dec. 12
When will it rain again in the Brockton area?
According to the NWS, the Brockton area won't see rain again until at least Monday, when there's a 40% chance of precipitation. Rain is likely on Tuesday, however, with the NWS predicting a 60% chance of precipitation.
